alert.note: Alert for Defiance; Henry (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 10:57PM EST until March 01 at 10:00PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Ohio... Maumee River near Defiance affecting Defiance and Henry Counties. .Recent rains and thunderstorms with periods of heavy rain has created excess runoff that will create minor river flooding through the week. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO LATE WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maumee River near Defiance. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to late Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding occurs in Kingsbury and Pontiac Parks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 10.2 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather Radio or local media for further statements and updated forecasts. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
